distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for spice-gtk and spice-server is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments (SPICE) is a remote display protocol for virtual environments. SPICE users can access a virtualized desktop or server from the local system or any system with network access to the server. SPICE is used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux for viewing virtualized guests running on the Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) hypervisor or on Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Hypervisors.

The spice-gtk packages provide a GIMP Toolkit (GTK+) widget for Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments (SPICE) clients. Both Virtual Machine Manager and Virtual Machine Viewer can make use of this widget to access virtual machines using the SPICE protocol.

Security Fix(es):

* spice: Missing check in demarshal.py:write_validate_array_item() allows for buffer overflow and denial of service (CVE-2018-10873)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

This issue was discovered by Frediano Ziglio (Red Hat).
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: spice-gtk and spice-server security update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A vulnerability was discovered in SPICE where the generated code used for demarshalling messages lacked sufficient bounds checks. A malicious client or server, after authentication, could send specially crafted messages to its peer which would result in a crash or, potentially, other impacts.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2018-10873 spice: Missing check in demarshal.py:write_validate_array_item() allows for buffer overflow and denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All applications using SPICE (most notably all QEMU-KVM instances using the SPICE console) must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2018-10873 spice: Missing check in demarshal.py:write_validate_array_item() allows for buffer overflow and denial of service
